content.rendered:
I'm an ambitious 20-something, and if you haven't noticed, this is a homemade website. Handcrafted, artisan, and non-GMO. This is what I do most of the time. I build custom software solutions and help others ideate on theirs. I love a good product, and I love it when an internet thing just works. There's lots of fun to be had here like reading, shopping, and playing games. Thanks for paying me a visit.

The latest thing I've done

I created a product that allows anyone to get their face on the web for dirt cheap.

view here

The latest thing I've written

I tried to buy a small business. My reasoning was a combination of entrepreneurial thirst and wanting to get to work in my community instead of on the interwebs for once. Here's how that went.

view here

The latest thing I've posted

I recorded this video on how I integrated Vercel's "buy a domain" functionality with my website. There were a couple key tricks that leverage some of the newest Next.js features.

view here

What I've been tinkering with

I interviewed for a role where I would have been building web apps with XML data and XSLT style sheets. In preparation, I used that stack to build a file-sharing feed. I have a private server with one public directory that I use as a file-sharing alternative. I used PHP to extrapolate data from that directory into XML format and then wrote a stylesheet that turns the boring /pub/ page into a nice looking feed.

view here
